metadata.title: CVE-2017-5123 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
Insufficient data validation in waitid allowed an user to escape sandboxeson Linux.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5123` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1005.7').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1002.5').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
